intro: Hieracium gyroflexum, commonly known as the spiral hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiral-shaped leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium gyroflexum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
